entries.meaning: An instance of being summoned to visit a certain place in order to provide assistance; an instance of summoning someone who is on call.
examples: I had to pay for the callout of the plumber after the pipe burst.

entries.meaning: (US) A meeting or rally held in order to find interested participants, e.g. for an activity or sports team.
examples: So many people attended the basketball callout that the coach decided to form two teams.

entries.meaning: A request for people to join or take part.

(typography, graphic layout) A pull quote: an excerpt from an article (such as in a news magazine) that is duplicated in a large font alongside the article so as to grab a reader's attention and indicate the article's topic.
An annotation that pertains to a specific location in a body of text or a graphic, and that is visually linked to that location by a mark or a matching pair of marks.
The act of calling out from work, i.e. announcing that one cannot attend; the act of calling in sick.
examples: On this particular day, I felt ill, mostly from exhaustion, and had to call out from work. This callout caused a stir and a display of animosity.

entries.meaning: (idiomatic) A form of verbal abuse with the intention to make the victim feel guilty.
